comments.body: `git config core.autocrlf false` will cause git to use whatever is actually in the repo, all the time. `input` or `false` should _probably_ be required for our repo, since we do actually have some tests which are newline-sensitive (though most get around newline coercion by having mixed newlines...), and newline coercion is unneeded with modern editors and tooling. So a backtick-literal here would be super nice.
